attributes.action: Make the NHS contact tracing app use Apple and Google’s API
attributes.additional_details: The API developed by Apple and Google ensures the app uses a decentralised approach and does not store our data on a server, along with being more robust and causing less battery drain on our devices. Help us to join Germany and a majority of other countries around the world in protecting user privacy by adopting a decentralised approach to this app. A centralised approach is an unnecessary cyber security risk and will deter a large number of users from downloading the app.
attributes.background: The NHS contact tracing app being developed will not use Apple and Google’s system and will therefore collect highly sensitive data and store it on a server instead of on our devices. This opens up our personal data to risk of attack or misuse.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318978

We can't accept petitions calling on the Government to use the services of a particular company or companies, as these decisions are subject to competition and procurement rules.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/
